title: Chris Rock also made a joke about Jada Pinkett Smith in 2016
description: In 2016, Chris Rock made another joke about Jada Pinkett Smith on the Oscars stage. See the moment and get the full story.

title: Watch the moment a Ukraine MP hears explosions while talking to CNN's Don Lemon
description: Ukraine MP Inna Sovsun spoke to CNN's Don Lemon about peace talks with Russia while "major explosions" occurred in Kyiv.

title: 'Unfortunately, I was right': Russian politician-turned-dissident speaks out
description: CNN Christiane Amanpour speaks with Russian dissident Ilya Ponomarev, who voted against the Russian annexation of Crimea in 2014, about the current state of the war after he joined the Ukrainian forces.

title: Judge: 'More likely than not' that Trump 'corruptly attempted' to obstruct Congress
description: A federal judge said Monday that former President Donald Trump and right-wing attorney John Eastman may have been planning a crime as they sought to disrupt the January 6 congressional certification of the presidential election.

title: Jared Kushner expected to appear before January 6 committee
description: Jared Kushner, son-in-law and former senior adviser to then-President Donald Trump, is expected to appear this week before the House select committee investigating the January 6, 2021, insurrection, according to two sources familiar with the planning.

title: Airlines want to drop mask and Covid-19 test rules. What do doctors say about it?
description: Mask mandates in the United States are speeding toward what could be their final frontier: transportation.

title: Ring camera captures car swerving before plowing into home
description: In Jacksonville, Florida, a neighbor's Ring surveillance camera caught the moment a car crashed into a home across the street. The driver, passenger, and a woman sitting on the home's front lawn were transported to the hospital and are recovering.

title: Panic at the supermarket as Shanghai forces residents into lockdown
description: Scuffles in the produce section, aisles packed with panicked shoppers and shelves stripped bare of food.

title: Evacuation orders for 8,000 homes are lifted after a Colorado wildfire torches parts of the Boulder area
description: All evacuation orders have been lifted after 19,000 residents were told to flee as the NCAR Fire ripped through part of Colorado, officials said.

title: How we finish the fight for gender equality once and for all
description: Covid-19 wreaked economic havoc on women globally, especially mothers, bringing into sharp focus the policies and practices that continue to thwart gender equality at work and at home.

title: Canada celebrates reaching first men's World Cup in 36 years
description: After a 36-year absence from the men's World Cup, Canada can now call itself a "legit football country."

title: Tesla plans another stock split
description: Tesla is asking its shareholders for permission to split its stock for the second time in two years.

title: Shanghai is locking down over 10 million people at a time. Why that's a big deal
description: Many countries around the world have decided to live with the coronavirus, even as a new subvariant fuels another wave of infections. But China is an extremely important exception.

title: Military analyst: What splitting Ukraine in 2 could look like
description: Ukraine's military intelligence head has warned that Putin could be looking at carving the country in two, similar to North and South Korea. CNN military analyst Cedric Leighton explains what a potential split of Ukraine would look like for Russia.

title: Ukrainians disrupt and derail Russian offensive as war moves to new phase
ISIS attack kills two and injures six in Israel
description: ISIS operatives killed two people and injured six in a shooting attack Sunday in the Israeli city of Hadera, some 31 miles north of Tel Aviv, Israeli officials said.

title: Huawei still fighting for 'survival' as Meng Wanzhou returns to corporate stage
description: Meng Wanzhou, the senior Huawei executive whose detainment in Canada became a flashpoint of US-China tensions, returned to the corporate stage Monday as sanctions continue to slam its business.

title: January 6 Committee likely to reach out to interview Ginni Thomas in coming weeks, sources say
description: Following the revelation of Virginia "Ginni" Thomas' text messages with then-White House chief of staff Mark Meadows, most members of the House select committee investigating January 6 -- including chair Bennie Thompson and vice chair Liz Cheney -- believe the panel should interview her, multiple sources familiar with the investigation told CNN.

title: Chris Rock isn't pressing charges against Will Smith for the Oscars slap
description: Chris Rock will not be pressing charges against Will Smith following their onstage altercation at this year's Oscars, the Los Angeles Police Department has said.

title: Elon Musk says he has Covid
description: Elon Musk says he has Covid for a second time, but he is feeling relatively well.

title: Zelensky: Moscow is 'frightened' after Kremlin bans an interview he gave
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky has accused Moscow of being "frightened" by journalists "who can tell the truth" after the Kremlin attempted to prevent Russians seeing an interview he gave about the war in Ukraine.

title: 'This invasion is horrifying': What it's like on the ground in Lviv following Russian missile attacks
description: At least five people were reportedly injured over the weekend after at least two missiles struck Lviv, a city in western Ukraine that had been previously spared the worst of Russia's brutal onslaught, local officials said.

title: Heineken is leaving Russia
description: Dutch brewer Heineken said Monday it will exit the Russian market following a review of its operations triggered by the invasion of Ukraine.

title: CNN reveals details around its new streaming service CNN+
description: CNN Executive VP and Chief Digital Officer Andrew Morse and CNN+ General Manager Alex MacCallum explain the unique features of CNN+, the network's streaming service set to launch on March 29.

title: What we know about the death of Foo Fighters drummer Taylor Hawkins
description: The death of Foo Fighters drummer Taylor Hawkins shook the music world this weekend, with fans and musicians everywhere reeling from the news of his passing at age 50.

title: Troy Kotsur's moving Oscar win brings audience to their feet with silent applause
The Italian village that wants to be a country
description: Atop an idyllic hill in the Italian Riviera sits a tiny village with a big dream: becoming an independent nation.

title: Chris Rock isn't pressing charges against Will Smith for the Oscars slap
Finland cuts one of the last trains between Russia and the EU
description: Finland's national railway operator said on Friday it would suspend services between Helsinki and St. Petersburg in Russia on Monday, closing the rail link between Russia and the European Union.

title: Studies link Covid-19 infection with increased risk of new diabetes diagnosis
description: Over a year after recovering from a Covid-19 infection, Jennifer Hobbs is adjusting to her new normal: brain fog, joint pain, elevated liver enzymes and, now, type 2 diabetes. Hobbs had prediabetes before she got Covid-19, but her blood sugar levels were under control, and she didn't need any treatment. Recently, that changed.

title: 'I just want to go home,' says Lewis Hamilton after finishing 10th in Saudi Arabian Grand Prix
description: Lewis Hamilton and Max Verstappen drove wheel-to-wheel last season and finished the season separated by only eight points in the final World Drivers' Championship standings.

title: Oscars controversy shines a light on Jada Pinkett Smith's struggle with alopecia
description: Jada Pinkett Smith found her struggle with hair loss at the center of an unexpected controversy at the Oscars on Sunday night, after her husband Will Smith appeared to strike comedian Chris Rock in response to a joke he made about her shaved head.

title: Scottie Scheffler becomes new world No. 1 after victory at WGC Match Play
description: Golf has a new world No. 1 and Scottie Scheffler can't quite believe it.

title: Former cyclist Tony Martin to auction off Olympic medal to raise funds for Ukrainian children
description: Olympic medalist Tony Martin is auctioning off the silver medal he won at London 2012 to raise funds for children in Ukraine.

title: Nostalgia can reduce perception of pain, study shows
description: The next time you feel pain, you might consider skipping the ibuprofen and reaching instead for an old photo.

title: 'Apathy is one of our biggest problems': Ocean photographer Shawn Heinrichs wants to save the seas
description: The images of sea life captured by photographer and cinematographer Shawn Heinrichs have a dual message: we should revere these majestic, yet fragile creatures, but we should also fear the prospect of their extinction.

title: Will Smith hits Chris Rock on stage during Oscars ceremony
description: Actor Will Smith walked onstage and hit comedian Chris Rock after he made a joke about Jada Pinkett Smith. Moments later, he won an Oscar.

title: Myanmar junta chief vows to annihilate opposition forces
description: Myanmar's junta chief on Sunday said the military would not negotiate with "terrorist" opposition forces, vowing to annihilate them during a speech on Armed Forces Day, as opponents of last year's coup vowed they would fight on.

title: Philippines slams Chinese ship's 'close distance maneuvering' in South China Sea
description: The Philippine Coast Guard (PCG) on Sunday reported a recent incident of "close distance maneuvering" by a Chinese Coast Guard (CCG) vessel in the disputed South China Sea that "constrained" the movement of a Philippine ship sailing nearby.

title: How Biden's 9 unscripted words could impact the war in Ukraine
description: • CNN questions NATO rep on walking back Biden's remarks

title: Meet Scot, the 1,600-pound great white shark swimming off Florida's coast
description: Florida's got yet another spring breaker in town: Scot, a massive great white shark, has been recorded swimming off the Gulf Coast.

title: Dollywood closes drop tower ride out of 'abundance of caution' after fatal fall at Orlando amusement park
description: Dollywood is temporarily closing its drop tower attraction after a boy fell to his death from a similar type of ride by the same manufacturer at a park in Orlando, a spokesman for Dolly Parton's Tennessee theme park said.

title: Biden's declaration that Putin 'cannot remain in power' was not a gaffe
description: President Joe Biden concluded his powerful speech this weekend in Poland about Vladimir Putin's barbaric attack on Ukraine with this line about the Russian leader: "For God's sake, this man cannot remain in power."
